block.p: Luisa Clayton Kroll, an associate editor at Forbes magazine in New York, was married yesterday to Andrew John Pelosi, the executive director of New Yorkers Against Gun Violence, an advocacy group. James Rogers III, a town justice of Lake Placid, N.Y., officiated at the Lake Placid Resort.

The bride, 31, will continue to use her name professionally. She graduated cum laude from Dartmouth College and received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia. She is a daughter of Lois and Arnold Kroll of Armonk, N.Y. Her father, a former managing director at Schroeder & Company, a New York investment bank, is a senior adviser at Burnham Securities in New York.

Her father, a former managing director at Schroeder & Company, a New York investment bank, is a senior adviser at Burnham Securities in New York.

The bridegroom, 36, graduated from Manhattanville College and received a master's degree in nonprofit management from the New School University. His mother, Anne Frieary of Keene Valley, N.Y., retired as a housekeeping manager at the Westchester Country Club in Rye, N.Y. His father, Andrew Pelosi, and stepmother, Lorraine Pelosi, of Tarpon Springs, Fla., own and operate private nursery and elementary schools in St. Petersburg and Seminole, Fla.
